tables.name: evm_blocks
tables.description: This table provides metadata about EVM blocks from the Cosmos ecosystem, including their height, timestamp, and hash. It offers a comprehensive view of the EVM blockchain activity.

columns.name: height
columns.description: The block height is a unique identifier for each EVM block in the Cosmos ecosystem, indicating its position in the blockchain.

columns.name: timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp represents the time at which a specific EVM block was added to the Cosmos blockchain, providing a temporal context for block activity.

columns.name: hash
columns.description: The hash is a digital fingerprint of the EVM block's contents, serving as a unique identifier and enabling efficient verification of block integrity.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The ingestion timestamp marks the time when the EVM block data was ingested into the database, reflecting the block's availability for analysis and querying.

tables.name: evm_logs
tables.description: This table contains Cosmos blockchain event logs, capturing key information from transactions and smart contract interactions.

columns.name: address
columns.description: The Ethereum address associated with the transaction or smart contract interaction.

columns.name: data
columns.description: The binary data associated with the transaction or smart contract interaction, such as the ABI- encoded function call.

columns.name: block_hash
columns.description: The hash of the block in which the transaction or smart contract interaction occurred.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log entry within the block, representing the order in which logs were generated.

columns.name: transaction_hash_evm
columns.description: The hash of the Ethereum transaction associated with the log entry.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the log entry was ingested into the database.

columns.name: topics
columns.description: The topics associated with the log entry, which can provide additional context about the event that occurred.

tables.name: evm_tokens_sales
tables.description: This table provides insights into token sales from various marketplaces within the Cosmos ecosystem, offering a snapshot of the blockchain's activity over time.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was mined.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The EVM transaction hash, linking the Cosmos transaction to the Ethereum Virtual Machine.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log entry within the transaction.

columns.name: marketplace
columns.description: The marketplace where the token sale occurred.

columns.name: from
columns.description: The address of the sender initiating the token sale.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The address of the recipient receiving the token sale.

columns.name: token_address
columns.description: The address of the token being sold.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evm_transactions
tables.description: This table contains Cosmos EVM transactions data, which are used to record and track the execution of smart contracts on the Cosmos EVM blockchain. The data includes transaction details, gas usage, and other relevant information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: hash
columns.description: The hash of the transaction.

columns.name: hash_evm
columns.description: The EVM hash of the transaction.

columns.name: evm_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the EVM block.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The total gas used by the transaction.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred in the transaction.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender in the transaction.

columns.name: evm_sender
columns.description: The EVM sender address of the transaction.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The address of the recipient in the transaction.

columns.name: code
columns.description: The EVM code of the transaction.

columns.name: data
columns.description: The data associated with the transaction.

columns.name: index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The gas limit of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_json
columns.description: The JSON data of the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction was ingested into the database.

columns.name: MsgEthereumTx
columns.description: The Ethereum transaction message.

columns.name: LegacyTx
columns.description: The legacy transaction type.

columns.name: AccessListTx
columns.description: The access list transaction type.

columns.name: DynamicFeeTx
columns.description: The dynamic fee transaction type.

columns.name: raw_data
columns.description: The raw data of the transaction.

columns.name: TxRaw
columns.description: The raw transaction data.

columns.name: gas_price
columns.description: The gas price of the transaction.

tables.name: evm_transfer_event
tables.description: This table contains a record of all transfer transactions that have occurred on the Cosmos ecosystem, providing an overview of the flow of assets across the network. It offers valuable insights into the activity and usage of various blockchain-based assets.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block within which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was mined.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) compatible transaction hash, often used for querying and tracking transactions across different blockchain platforms.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique identifier for the transaction, generated by the blockchain network.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log entry within the transaction.

columns.name: token_address
columns.description: The address of the token being transferred, identifying the specific cryptocurrency or asset.

columns.name: from
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the transfer, originating the transaction.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The address of the account that received the transferred asset.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The quantity of the transferred asset, measured in the token's native unit of account.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the transaction data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evm_transfer_single_event
tables.description: This table provides a snapshot of Cosmos blockchain's token transfers, offering insights into token movements across the network. It captures essential details about each transfer event.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the transfer event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transfer event was recorded in the blockchain.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) transaction hash associated with the transfer event.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the Cosmos blockchain transaction that triggered the transfer event.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log entry within the transaction that recorded the transfer event.

columns.name: token_address
columns.description: The address of the token being transferred.

columns.name: operator
columns.description: The address of the operator involved in the transfer event.

columns.name: from
columns.description: The address from which the tokens were transferred.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The address to which the tokens were transferred.

columns.name: id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transfer event.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred during the event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transfer event data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evm_uniswap_v2_dex_swaps
tables.description: This table contains information on Uniswap V2 DEX swaps executed on the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into liquidity provision and token exchange. The data is sourced from blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the swap transaction was executed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block where the swap transaction was executed.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) transaction hash associated with the swap execution.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The transaction hash of the swap execution, unique to the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address that initiated the swap transaction.

columns.name: evm_sender
columns.description: The EVM address associated with the sender, used for compatibility with EVM-based protocols.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log entry related to the swap transaction.

columns.name: pair
columns.description: The token pair involved in the swap, represented as a combination of the two tokens.

columns.name: dex_router
columns.description: The router contract address used to execute the swap on the Uniswap V2 DEX.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The recipient address where the swapped tokens were sent.

columns.name: amount_0_in
columns.description: The amount of the first token (denoted by position 0 in the pair) sent to the router.

columns.name: amount_1_in
columns.description: The amount of the second token (denoted by position 1 in the pair) sent to the router.

columns.name: amount_0_out
columns.description: The amount of the first token (denoted by position 0 in the pair) received after the swap.

columns.name: amount_1_out
columns.description: The amount of the second token (denoted by position 1 in the pair) received after the swap.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the swap data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evmos_blocks
tables.description: This table contains information about each block in the Cosmos ecosystem, including block height and timestamp, as well as details about the proposer and validators.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: proposer_address
columns.description: The address of the validator that proposed the block.

columns.name: validators_hash
columns.description: A hash of the validators that secured the block.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block data was ingested into the system.

columns.name: messages_bytes
columns.description: The total size of the messages in the block in bytes.

columns.name: tx_count
columns.description: The number of transactions in the block.

tables.name: evmos_convert_ERC20
tables.description: This table provides information on ERC20 token transfers within the Cosmos ecosystem. It includes details on block information, transaction data, and token amounts.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was mined.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was mined.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender of the ERC20 token.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address of the recipient of the ERC20 token.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of the ERC20 token transferred.

columns.name: erc20_token
columns.description: The details of the ERC20 token being transferred, including its symbol and contract address.

columns.name: cosmos_coin
columns.description: The equivalent amount of Cosmos coin (if any) that was transferred or affected by the ERC20 token transfer.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_convert_coin
tables.description: This dataset contains transactional data from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into blockchain activity. It captures key information about each transaction, including sender, receiver, and asset movements.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block that contains the transaction.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action number within the transaction message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the transaction.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address of the account that received the transaction.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of assets transferred in the transaction.

columns.name: cosmos_coin
columns.description: The type of Cosmos-based coin transferred in the transaction.

columns.name: erc20_token
columns.description: The type of ERC-20 token transferred in the transaction ("-1" indicates no ERC-20 token transfer).

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_delegate
tables.description: This table provides a detailed breakdown of token transactions on the Cosmos blockchain, enabling users to monitor the distribution and movement of tokens across the ecosystem. It offers insights into the activities of validators and the impact of their actions on token balances.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the transaction was mined

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The validator responsible for processing the transaction

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: delegator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: parsed_EVMOS_amount
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: new_shares
columns.description: The new shares allocated to the validator as a result of the transaction

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction was ingested into the data source

tables.name: evmos_developer_revenue
tables.description: This table provides a comprehensive view of revenue generated by developers from the Cosmos ecosystem's blockchains. It captures essential transactional data, including sender, amount, and contract information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the transaction was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was mined.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action number of the specific action within the transaction.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender who initiated the transaction.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of cryptocurrency transferred or received during the transaction.

columns.name: amount_in_usdc
columns.description: The equivalent value of the amount in USDC (a stablecoin).

columns.name: contract
columns.description: The contract address involved in the transaction.

columns.name: withdraw_address
columns.description: The address where the funds were withdrawn or sent.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evmos_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides a consolidated view of attribute data from various blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem. It allows for the analysis of blockchain activity and attribute values over time.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block that the event was part of, representing the number of blocks in the blockchain

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the blockchain network, used to distinguish between different networks

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the transaction, used to track the transaction's history

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: Index of the event in the transaction, used to identify the specific event

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: Type of the event, indicating the type of action that occurred

columns.name: event_source
columns.description: Source of the event, indicating the module or contract that triggered the event

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: Key of the attribute, used to identify the attribute being tracked

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: Value of the attribute, providing additional context about the event

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: Index of the attribute in the event, used to track multiple attributes

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system, indicating the time of data availability

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the block was created, indicating the time of the event

tables.name: evmos_ibc_receive
tables.description: This table represents IBC receive transactions across the Cosmos ecosystem, capturing the flow of tokens from one chain to another. It provides a comprehensive view of receiver addresses, token movements, and associated metadata.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The block height of the transaction within the source chain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction block was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action index of the transaction.

columns.name: packet_src_channel
columns.description: The source channel ID of the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_dts_channel
columns.description: The destination channel ID of the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_connection
columns.description: The connection ID associated with the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_sequence
columns.description: The sequence number of the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_ack
columns.description: The acknowledgement status of the IBC packet.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender of the IBC transaction.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address of the receiver of the IBC transaction.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred during the IBC transaction.

columns.name: token_path
columns.description: The path of tokens transferred during the IBC transaction.

columns.name: token_alias
columns.description: The alias of the token transferred during the IBC transaction.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the token transferred during the IBC transaction.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: Additional information associated with the IBC transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_ibc_transfer
tables.description: This table captures IBC transfer events across the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into token movements between different chains and channels. It offers a comprehensive view of the IBC network's activity.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the IBC transfer event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the IBC transfer event occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that initiated the IBC transfer.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that initiated the IBC transfer.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action number within the message that initiated the IBC transfer.

columns.name: packet_src_channel
columns.description: The source channel of the packet involved in the IBC transfer.

columns.name: packet_dts_channel
columns.description: The destination channel of the packet involved in the IBC transfer.

columns.name: packet_connection
columns.description: The connection of the packet involved in the IBC transfer.

columns.name: packet_sequence
columns.description: The sequence number of the packet involved in the IBC transfer.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender involved in the IBC transfer.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address of the receiver involved in the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_path
columns.description: The path of tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_alias
columns.description: The alias of tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: The memo associated with the IBC transfer, if any.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the IBC transfer event was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evmos_ibc_transfer_delays
tables.description: This table tracks delays in IBC transfers within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the performance and reliability of inter-blockchain communication. It aggregates data from various blockchain sources to offer a comprehensive view of transfer delays.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each IBC transfer transaction.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block where the IBC transfer transaction was processed.

columns.name: ack_block_height
columns.description: Height of the block where the IBC transfer transaction was acknowledged.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the sender that initiated the IBC transfer.

columns.name: tx_delay
columns.description: Time delay in seconds between the transaction sending and its acknowledgement.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block where the IBC transfer transaction was processed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_message_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides a detailed view of blockchain activity within the Cosmos ecosystem, including key information about transactions and their associated attributes. It offers valuable insights into the behavior and characteristics of blockchain usage within this ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block within which the transaction was processed.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the Cosmos blockchain network, used to distinguish between different networks.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction, used to track its progress and status.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction, with messages being processed in order.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the message, with events being processed in order.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: A description of the type of event that occurred, such as a contract creation or a token transfer.

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: A key-value pair that provides additional information about the event, with the key describing the attribute and the value providing the actual data.

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: The value associated with an attribute key, providing additional context about the event.

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: The index of the attribute within the event, with attributes being processed in order.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system, used for tracking data freshness and latency.

tables.name: evmos_message_types_transactions
tables.description: This table provides a detailed overview of transactional data from various blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem, including message types sent between nodes. It offers insights into the messaging activity that enables the functioning of the Cosmos network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the transaction was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender of the message.

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: The type of message sent between nodes, enabling various functions within the Cosmos network.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_redelegate
tables.description: This table contains information about validator redelegations within the Cosmos ecosystem. It tracks the redelegation of tokens from one validator to another, providing insights into the movement of tokens within the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the redelegation transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the redelegation transaction was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that initiated the redelegation.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: source_validator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: source_moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: destination_validator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: destination_moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: delegator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: evmos_amount
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: The time at which the redelegation was completed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the redelegation data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_sends
tables.description: This table contains transaction data from blockchains in the Cosmos ecosystem, focusing on the sending of tokens between accounts. It provides a comprehensive view of token movements across the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block at which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was created, indicating when the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that triggered the token send.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action within the message that transferred the tokens.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that initiated the token send.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The account that received the tokens.

columns.name: tokens_amount
columns.description: The total amount of tokens sent in the transaction.

columns.name: tokens_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens sent, indicating the type of token (e.g., ATOM, OSMO).

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_transactions
tables.description: This table contains a comprehensive record of transactions from the Cosmos ecosystem. Each transaction includes relevant metadata for auditing and analysis.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block within the Cosmos blockchain that this transaction was included in.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the specific Cosmos blockchain that this transaction belongs to.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for this transaction within the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: tx_info
columns.description: A JSON object containing additional information about this transaction.

columns.name: tx_log_message
columns.description: A log message generated during the processing of this transaction.

columns.name: fee
columns.description: The fee paid for processing this transaction, expressed in a specific denomination.

columns.name: tx_code
columns.description: The code returned by the Cosmos blockchain after processing this transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of this transaction within the block that it was included in.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The amount of gas consumed by this transaction during processing.

columns.name: gas_wanted
columns.description: The amount of gas requested for processing this transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when this transaction was ingested into the database.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A memo or note associated with this transaction.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to store this transaction.

columns.name: fee_coins
columns.description: The coins used to pay the fee for processing this transaction.

columns.name: fee_granter
columns.description: The account that granted the fee for processing this transaction.

columns.name: fee_payer
columns.description: The account that paid the fee for processing this transaction.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The maximum amount of gas that can be consumed by this transaction.

columns.name: single_sign_mode
columns.description: A flag indicating whether this transaction was processed in single-sign mode.

columns.name: multi_sign_json
columns.description: A JSON object containing multi-signature information for this transaction.

columns.name: timeout_height
columns.description: The height of the block where this transaction will timeout if not processed.

tables.name: evmos_undelegate
tables.description: This table provides information on undelegation operations across Cosmos blockchain validators. It contains details about the transaction, sender, and validator involved in the undelegation process.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the undelegation transaction was processed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the undelegation transaction was processed.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The address of the validator being undelegated from.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: delegator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: parsed_EVMOS_amount
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: The time at which the undelegation process was completed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_validators
tables.description: This table contains information about validators in the Cosmos ecosystem, including their operator addresses, jailed status, and commission rates.

columns.name: account_address
columns.description: Address associated with the validator account.

columns.name: operator_address
columns.description: Unique address of the validator operator.

columns.name: consensus_pubkey
columns.description: Public key used for consensus in the validator's public keyring.

columns.name: status
columns.description: Current status of the validator, including values such as 'bonded', 'unbonding', or 'unbonded'.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: Human-readable name of the validator.

columns.name: identity
columns.description: Identity of the validator, including any relevant information.

columns.name: rate
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: max_rate
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: min_self_delegation
columns.description: Minimum amount of tokens that must be self-delegated to the validator.

columns.name: Network
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: Snapshot_date
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: proposer_hashed_address
columns.description: No description available

tables.name: evmos_voting
tables.description: This table contains voting data from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into block height, voting activity, and proposal outcomes. It allows users to analyze the voting behavior of validators and community members.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block on the Cosmos blockchain where the voting activity occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block on the Cosmos blockchain where the voting activity occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction that initiated the voting activity.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that triggered the voting activity.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The index of the action within the message that initiated the voting activity.

columns.name: voter
columns.description: The validator or community member who cast the vote.

columns.name: proposal_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the proposal being voted on.

columns.name: proposal_option
columns.description: The specific option chosen by the voter in relation to the proposal.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the voting data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_withdraw_rewards
tables.description: This table contains information about validator reward withdrawals in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into validator activity and token movement across the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the withdrawal transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the withdrawal transaction was mined.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the withdrawal transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the withdrawal message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The index of the withdrawal action within the message.

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The Cosmos validator account that initiated the withdrawal.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: The display name of the validator account.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The account that received the withdrawn rewards.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens withdrawn from the validator account.

columns.name: token_amount_in_usdc
columns.description: The value of the withdrawn tokens in USDC (USD Coin).

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the withdrawn tokens.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the withdrawal data was ingested into the system.
